intro: Symplocos ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian wax myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of Ecuador and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their astringent properties. Symplocos ecuadorensis plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
